00049 /** 
00050  * Make a string from an integer.
00051  * @param i - integer to be converted.
00052  * 
00053  * @return - String version of int i;
00054  */
00055 string Convert::toString(int i) {
00056   stringstream ss;
00057   string str;
00058   ss << i;
00059   ss >> str;
00060   return str;
00061 }

00066     ss << i;
00067     ss >> str;
00068     return str;

00071 /** 
00072  * Make a string from an double
00073  * @param d - double to be converted.
00074  * 
00075  * @return - String version of int i;
00076  */
00077 std::string Convert::toString(double d) {
00078   stringstream ss;
00079   string str;
00080   ss << d;
00081   ss >> str;
00082 
00083   // we prefer the linux format (inf/nan) to that of the windows output.
00084   // convert the strings to our perfered format.
00085   if (str == "-Inf") {
00086     str = "-inf";
00087   }
00088   else if (str == "Inf") {
00089     str = "inf";
00090   }
00091 #ifdef WIN32
00092   else if (str.size() >= 5) {
00093     if (str == "-1.#INF") {
00094       str="-inf";
00095     } 
00096     else if (str == "1.#INF") {
00097       str="inf";
00098     }
00099     else if (str == "-1.#IND") {
00100       str="nan";
00101     }
00102     else if (str == "1.#IND") {
00103       str="nan";
00104     }
00105     // For Windows, check to see if a three digit exponent with a leading zero
00106     // is being used for double representation.  if so, remove the extra zero
00107     // (2 exponent digits conforms to 1999 C standard) 
00108     // e.g. 1.234e003 and 1.234e-003 become 1.234e03 and 1.234e-03
00109     else if (str.at(str.size() - 3) == '0' &&
00110              (str.at(str.size() - 4) == 'e' || 
00111               str.at(str.size() - 5) == 'e')
00112              ) {
00113       str.erase(str.size() - 3, 1);
00114     }
00115   }
00116 #endif
00117   return str;
00118 }

00120 /** 
00121  * Make an int from a c string or die trying.
00122  * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00123  * 
00124  * @return - Integer representation of num
00125  */
00126 int Convert::toInt(const std::string& num) {
00127   bool success = true;
00128   int i = Convert::toIntCheck(num, &success);
00129   if(success != true)
00130     Err::errAbort("Could not convert '" + std::string(num) + "' to an int.");
00131   return i;
00132 }
00133 
00134 /** 
00135  * Make an int from a c string.
00136  * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00137  * @param success - If success != NULL set to true upon 
00138  *   successful conversion and false upon failur.
00139  * @return - Integer representation of num, 0 if success == false
00140  */
00141 int Convert::toIntCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success) {
00142   long int l = 0;
00143   int i = 0;
00144   bool ok = true;
00145   char *end = NULL;
00146   const char* num_c_str=num.c_str();
00147 
00148   assert(num_c_str); 
00149   errno = 0;
00150   l = strtol(num_c_str, &end, 10);
00151 
00152   // end will be NULL if entire string converted.
00153   ok = (*end != '\0' || end == num_c_str) ? false : true;
00154   
00155   // cast to int and make sure that we didn't overflow
00156   i = (int)l;
00157   if(errno != 0 || (long)i != l)
00158     ok = false;
00159 
00160   // if we had a problem set to 0 for consistency.
00161   if(!ok)
00162     i = 0;
00163 
00164   if(success != NULL)
00165     (*success) = ok;
00166 
00167   return i;
00168 }
00169

00173  * 
00174  * @return - Unsigned Integer representation of num
00175  */
00176 unsigned int Convert::toUnsignedInt(const std::string& num) {

00178   unsigned int i = Convert::toUnsignedIntCheck(num, &success);
00179   if(success != true)
00180     Err::errAbort("Could not convert '" + std::string(num) + "' to an unsigned int.");
00181   return i;
00182 }

00200 /** 
00201  * Make an unsigned int from a c string.
00202  * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00203  * @param success - If success != NULL set to true upon 
00204  *   successful conversion and false upon failur.
00205  * @return - Unsigned Integer representation of num, 0 if success == false
00206  */
00207 unsigned int Convert::toUnsignedIntCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success) {
00208   long unsigned int l = 0;
00209   unsigned int i = 0;
00210   bool ok = true;
00211   char *end = NULL;
00212   const char* num_c_str=num.c_str();
00213 
00214   assert(num_c_str); 
00215   errno = 0;
00216   l = strtoul(num_c_str, &end, 10);
00217 
00218   // end will be NULL if entire string converted.
00219   ok = (*end != '\0' || end == num_c_str) ? false : true;
00220 
00221   // cast to unsigned int and make sure that we didn't overflow
00222   i = (unsigned int)l;
00223   if(errno != 0 || (long unsigned int)i != l || l >= UINT_MAX) 
00224     ok = false;
00225 
00226   // if we had a problem set to 0 for consistency.
00227   if(!ok)
00228     i = 0;
00229 
00230   if(success != NULL)
00231     (*success) = ok;
00232 
00233   return i;
00234 }

00236 uint64_t Convert::toUnsignedInt64Check(const std::string& num, bool *success) {
00237   long unsigned int l = 0;
00238   uint64_t i = 0;
00239   bool ok = true;
00240   char *end = NULL;
00241   const char* num_c_str=num.c_str();
00242

00244   errno = 0;
00245   l = strtoul(num_c_str, &end, 10);
00246 
00247   // end will be NULL if entire string converted.
00248   ok = (*end != '\0' || end == num_c_str) ? false : true;
00249 
00250   // cast to unsigned int and make sure that we didn't overflow
00251   i = (uint64_t)l;
00252   if(errno != 0 || (long unsigned int)i != l || l >= ULONG_MAX) 
00253     ok = false;
00254 
00255   // if we had a problem set to 0 for consistency.
00256   if(!ok)
00257     i = 0;
00258 
00259   if(success != NULL)
00260     (*success) = ok;
00261 
00262   return i;

00265 int64_t Convert::toInt64Check(const std::string& num, bool *success) {
00266     long long int l = 0;
00267     int64_t i = 0;
00268     bool ok = true;
00269     char *end = NULL;
00270     const char* num_c_str = num.c_str();
00271 
00272     assert(num_c_str);
00273     errno = 0;
00274     l = strtoul(num_c_str, &end, 10);
00275 
00276     // end will be NULL if entire string converted.
00277     ok = (*end != '\0' || end == num_c_str) ? false : true;
00278 
00279     // cast to signed int64 and make sure that we didn't overflow
00280     i = (int64_t)l;
00281     if (errno != 0 || (long long int)i != l || l >= LONG_MAX)
00282         ok = false;
00283 
00284     // if we had a problem set to 0 for consistency.
00285     if (!ok)
00286         i = 0;
00287 
00288     if (success != NULL)
00289         (*success) = ok;
00290 
00291     return i;
00292 }

00294 /** 
00295  * Make an float from a c string.
00296  * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00297  * 
00298  * @return - Float representation of num
00299  */
00300 float Convert::toFloat(const std::string& num) {
00301   bool success = true;
00302   float f = toFloatCheck(num, &success);
00303   if(!success) 
00304     Err::errAbort("Could not convert '" + std::string(num) + "' to a float.");
00305   return f;
00306 }
00307 
00308 /** 
00309  * Make an float from a c string.
00310  * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00311  * @param success - If success != NULL set to true upon 
00312  *   successful conversion and false upon failur.
00313  * @return - Float representation of num
00314  */
00315 float Convert::toFloatCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success) {
00316   double d = toDoubleCheck(num, success);
00317   if(d > FLT_MAX && d < DBL_MAX) {
00318     (*success) = false;
00319   }
00320   return float(d);
00321 }

00325  * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00326  * 
00327  * @return - Double representation of num
00328  */
00329 double Convert::toDouble(const std::string& num){
00330   bool success = true;
00331   double d = Convert::toDoubleCheck(num, &success);
00332 
00333   if(!success)
00334     Err::errAbort("Could not convert '" + std::string(num) + "' to a double.");
00335 
00336   return d;
00337 }
00338 
00339 /** 
00340  * Make an double from a c string.
00341  * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00342  * @param success - If success != NULL set to true upon 
00343  *   successful conversion and false upon failur.
00344  * @return - Double representation of num
00345  */
00346 double Convert::toDoubleCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success){
00347   const char* num_c_str=num.c_str();
00348   assert(num_c_str);
00349 
00350   double d = 0;
00351 
00352   if (num == "NaN") {
00353       d = numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
00354       *success = true;
00355       return d;
00356   }
00357 
00358   char *end = NULL;
00359   bool ok = true;
00360   errno = 0;
00361   d = strtod(num_c_str, &end);
00362 
00363   // end will point at NULL if conversion successful
00364   ok = (*end != '\0' || end == num_c_str) ? false : true;
00365 
00366   /* errno should be set if over/under flow. ERANGE is a special case
00367      though of number not being represetable. For ERANGE just let things
00368      be with a warning...
00369 
00370      from https://www.securecoding.cert.org:
00371      "For numeric conversion functions in the strtod(), strtol(),
00372      wcstod(), and wcstol() families, if the correct result is outside
00373      the range of representable values, an appropriate minimum or
00374      maximum value is returned, and the value ERANGE is stored in
00375      errno.  For floating-point conversion functions in the strtod()
00376      and wcstod() families, if an underflow occurs, whether errno
00377      acquires the value ERANGE is implementation-defined."
00378   */
00379 
00380   if (errno != 0 && errno != ERANGE) {
00381     ok = false;
00382   }
00383 
00384   if (errno == ERANGE) {
00385     Verbose::out(3, "Warning - number: " + num + " is out of range (ERANGE set)");
00386     errno = 0;
00387   }
00388   /* If not ok set to NAN to be non-usable. */
00389   if (!ok) {
00390     d = 0.0;
00391     // @todo - check that NAN won't break everything...
00392     // d = NAN;
00393   }
00394   if(success != NULL)
00395     (*success) = ok;
00396 
00397   return d;
00398 }
00399 
00400 /** 
00401  * Make an bool from a c string.
00402  * @param flag - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00403  *    allowed value are 'true' && 'false'
00404  * @return - Bool representation of flag
00405  */
00406 bool Convert::toBool(const std::string& flag) {
00407   bool value = false, success = false;
00408   value = Convert::toBoolCheck(flag, &success);
00409   if(!success)
00410     Err::errAbort("Could not convert '" + std::string(flag) + "' to a boolean.\n"
00411                   "Valid values are: 'true','false','1','0'.");
00412   return value;
00413 }
00414 
00415 /** 
00416  * Make an bool from a c string.
00417  * @param flag - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00418  *   allowed value are 'true' && 'false'
00419  * @param success - If success != NULL set to true upon 
00420  *   successful conversion and false upon failur.
00421  * @return - Bool representation of flag, false on failure.
00422  */
00423 bool Convert::toBoolCheck(const std::string& flag, bool *success) {
00424   bool value = false;
00425   bool ok = true;
00426   const char* flag_c_str=flag.c_str();
00427 
00428   assert(flag_c_str);
00429 
00430   // would like to use strcasecmp, but VC++ doesnt have it
00431   if ((strcmp(flag_c_str, "true") == 0) ||
00432       (strcmp(flag_c_str, "TRUE") == 0) ||
00433       (strcmp(flag_c_str, "1")    == 0)) {
00434     value = true;
00435   }
00436   else if ((strcmp(flag_c_str, "false") == 0) ||
00437            (strcmp(flag_c_str, "FALSE") == 0) ||
00438            (strcmp(flag_c_str, "0") == 0)) {
00439     value = false;
00440   }
00441   else 
00442     ok = false;
00443 
00444   if(success != NULL)
00445     (*success) = ok;
00446 
00447   return value;
00448 }
00449 
00450 /** 
00451  * Test to make sure that two doubles are pretty similar.
00452  * @param f1 
00453  * @param f2 
00454  * @return true if doubles are same to 6 significant digits.
00455  */
00456 bool Convert::doubleCloseEnough(double d1, double d2, int digits) {
00457   double diff = fabs(d1 - d2);
00458   if(diff < 1 / (pow(10.0, (double)digits)))
00459     return true;
00460   return false;
00461 }

00463 /** 
00464  * Make a low precision float from a normal one. Used originally to
00465  * mimic truncation seen in cel files.
00466  * @param f float to be truncated.
00467  * @return truncated float
00468  */
00469 float Convert::floatLowPrecision(float f) {
00470   return (float)((floor((f+0.05)*10))/10.0);
00471 }

00473 void
00474 Convert::strToIntVec(const std::string& s,const char delim,std::vector<int>& vec)
00475 {
00476   std::vector<string> words;
00477   Util::chopString(s,delim, words);
00478   vec.clear();
00479   vec.resize(words.size());
00480   for(size_t i = 0; i < words.size(); i++) {
00481     vec[i] = Convert::toInt(words[i]);
00482   }
00483 }

00487 {

00489   Util::chopString(s, delim, words);
00490   vec.clear();
00491   vec.resize(words.size());
00492   for(int i = 0; i < words.size(); i++) {
00493     vec[i] = Convert::toDouble(words[i]);

00497 /**
00498  * Convert an integer vector to string
00499  */
00500 std::string Convert::intVecToString(const std::vector<int> &inputVector, const std::string &delim)
00501 {
00502     if (inputVector.empty()) {
00503         return "";
00504     }
00505 
00506     std::string str;
00507     for (std::vector<int>::const_iterator it = inputVector.begin(); it != inputVector.end(); ++it)
00508     {
00509         str += delim + toString(*it);
00510     }
00511     return str.substr(delim.size());
00512 }
00513

00515  * Convert a double vector to string
00516  */
00517 std::string Convert::doubleVecToString(const std::vector<double> &inputVector, const std::string &delim)
00518 {
00519     if (inputVector.empty()) {
00520         return "";
00521     }
00522 
00523     std::string str;
00524     for (std::vector<double>::const_iterator it = inputVector.begin(); it != inputVector.end(); ++it)
00525     {
00526         str += delim + toString(*it);
00527     }
00528     return str.substr(delim.size());

00531 /**
00532  * Convert a string vector to string. Silly but someone's got to do it.
00533  */
00534 std::string Convert::strVecToString(const std::vector<std::string> &inputVector, const std::string &delim)
00535 {
00536     if (inputVector.empty()) {
00537         return "";
00538     }
00539 
00540     std::string str;
00541     for (std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator it = inputVector.begin(); it != inputVector.end(); ++it)
00542     {
00543         str += delim + *it;
00544     }
00545     return str.substr(delim.size());
